New Records: India scored 196 runs in their innings, their highest score in the T20 World Cup 2024.
Bangladesh scored 146 runs in their innings.
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya scored a 27-ball half-century (50 runs) for India.
Kuldeep Yadav took crucial wickets for India.
Rishabh Pant made a significant contribution with 36 runs before being dismissed.
Bangladesh's Mahmudullah and Shakib Al Hasan had important performances.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and chose to bowl first.
India's batting coach Vikram Rathour highlighted the importance of the match for Virat Kohli's form.
Post-Match Reflections: India's victory moved them closer to the semifinals.
Bangladesh's performance was analyzed by their captain Najmul Hossain Shanto.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua.
The highest PowerPlay score for India in the tournament was 53 runs.
